skill.name: obsidian-markdown
skill.description: Create and edit Obsidian Flavored Markdown with wikilinks, embeds, callouts, properties, and other Obsidian-specific syntax. Use when working with .md files in Obsidian, or when the user mentions wikilinks, callouts, frontmatter, tags, embeds, or Obsidian notes.
skill.summary: Create and edit Obsidian Flavored Markdown with wikilinks, embeds, callouts, properties, and other O...
skill.author: kepano

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only Markdown syntax references. No executable code exists. The 'external_commands' findings are false positives from Markdown code block delimiters. 'Weak cryptographic algorithm' findings are LaTeX math expressions. 'C2 keywords' and 'system reconnaissance' are false positives from technical terminology. All 223 static findings are dismissed as documentation artifacts, not security risks.

content.value_statement: Obsidian uses unique syntax extensions beyond standard Markdown. This skill provides complete reference documentation for wikilinks, callouts, properties, embeds, and other Obsidian-specific features. Use this skill to generate valid Obsidian notes that work seamlessly with the Obsidian app.
actual_capabilities: Create wikilinks between notes using [[Note Name]] syntax
Format callouts with > [!type] blocks (note, tip, warning, etc.)
Add YAML frontmatter properties to notes
Embed images, PDFs, audio, and other notes with ![[filename]] syntax
Use block IDs for precise linking to specific content
Format Mermaid diagrams, LaTeX math, and footnotes
limitations: This skill provides documentation and syntax guidance only
Does not interact with Obsidian app or vault files directly
Does not execute Obsidian commands or plugins

use_cases.title: Create complex notes
use_cases.description: Generate richly linked notes with callouts, properties, and internal links for personal knowledge management

use_cases.title: Format documentation
use_cases.description: Create well-structured documentation with Mermaid diagrams, code blocks, and cross-references

use_cases.title: Build linked knowledge bases
use_cases.description: Connect research notes with wikilinks, embed supporting materials, and organize with tags and properties

prompt_templates.title: Basic note structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Obsidian note with a title, date, and tags in the frontmatter. Include a brief overview section with a callout for the key takeaway.

prompt_templates.title: Linking content
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a section with internal links to three related notes using wikilinks. Also include a link to a specific heading in another note.

prompt_templates.title: Embedded content
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to embed an image, a PDF page, and a section from another note. Include the syntax for each embed type.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced features
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an example showing Mermaid diagram, LaTeX math block, and a folded callout. Also demonstrate block IDs and footnotes.

output_examples.input: Create a project meeting note with a summary callout, a task list, and links to related meeting notes
output: Frontmatter with title, date, tags, and status
Task list with checkboxes showing progress
Wikilinks to meeting notes and action items

output_examples.input: Format a research summary with LaTeX math, a Mermaid flowchart, and footnotes
Create a knowledge base entry with properties, tags, and embedded images
output: YAML frontmatter with title, date, tags, and aliases
Body content with wikilinks to related notes
Image embed with custom width parameter

best_practices: Use frontmatter properties consistently for better search and filtering in Obsidian
Prefer wikilinks over standard Markdown links for internal note connections
Use block IDs when you need to reference specific paragraphs or list items
anti_patterns: Avoid mixing wikilinks and standard links inconsistently within the same vault
Do not forget the blank line before and after callout content
Avoid using special characters without escaping in table cells with pipes

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Obsidian mobile?
faq.answer: Yes. Obsidian Flavored Markdown works the same on mobile and desktop apps.

faq.question: What is the character limit for notes?
faq.answer: Obsidian notes can be very large. Performance depends on your device memory.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with Obsidian plugins?
faq.answer: This skill generates standard syntax. Some plugins add extended features beyond basic OFM.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation skill that only generates text. No data is stored or transmitted.

faq.question: Why is my callout not displaying correctly?
faq.answer: Ensure there is a blank line before the callout content and after the closing > symbols.

faq.question: How does this compare to standard Markdown?
faq.answer: Obsidian Flavored Markdown extends standard Markdown with wikilinks, callouts, properties, and embeds.
